channel.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
channel.description:
Has anyone signup and release your tracks using Level Music?
[https://beta.levelmusic.com/](https://beta.levelmusic.com/)
if anyone interested you can use access code: TEAMLEVEL2018
As i read through on their sites, it is free to distribute (only they will take 8% if tracks are sold)
They even provide ASAP Release option ![image|281x499](upload://zNNlh0lg97OXrYPJhsxgaBNXI82.png)
I have actually signup (but i have not uploaded any tracks yet, but i might try the ASAP Release to see how it goes), since Amuse App is no longer available in Malaysia App Store, so i guess i still have a different options 😄
So maybe another App like Amuse....

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Thought they had a 7000 plays per track + good levels of engagement threshold.
(Not meant as a diss.)

Still, if you are using them, would be great if you could post a review in the Branding & Distribution category.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: cgedius
item.description:
akabillposters:

It’s interesting that Level appears to allow you to specify countries.

Yea Amuse does that too, well basically mirroring what Amuse has to offer (and 1 more thing Level even specified the cover design for itunes is 2400x2400 in which i usually do for Amuse is 1700x1700, exceed what Amuse require 1600x1600)

Well i guess I really interested their ASAP Release option tho.

Hopefully i don’t intend to do anything different from what I’m producing.

And i might go for this as well Beta Amuse
(Only thing is I’m just worried about the last bit)

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
It’s interesting that Level appears to allow you to specify countries.
Distrokid doesn’t let you specify.

The releases are submitted to the services. After that, it’s down to which countries the services are available in.
(…though some countries will automatically reject any tracks with explicit content.)

 
I’m not sure how different they’d be to Distrokid, but I wouldn’t mind trying both Amuse and Level as well. I’m intrigued by their more modern orientation.

Maybe if I have a third and fourth musical identity, I’ll try both Amuse and Level out.
(My Distrokid account allows two different artist names/identities.)

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: cgedius
item.description:
Yea mate, As long it’s within schedule release… its fine

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah Amuse does not have an immediate option I was ready to actual release the day I submitted but had to schedule it out a week ahead. Ah well.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: cgedius
item.description:
akabillposters:

Don’t all digital distributors effectively offer some kind of ‘asap’ option?

I think Amuse is 7days the latest, if not mistaken, and yea Amuse is kinda popular

akabillposters:

It’s good that we’ll have real experience to share about the various options

Yup true, the more platform in the market the more option it will be for releasing tracks. ️

So i’m currently taking “time off” from Amuse, but if they permanently blocking their app in Malaysia, then LEVEL its shall be

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone has signup with beta.levelmusic.com?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Don’t all digital distributors effectively offer some kind of ‘asap’ option?

I’m with Distrokid and to release asap, you’d simply select the default date setting, which is typically the current day.

 
Aside: We seem to be gathering a range of different digital distribution accounts.

Amuse is popular. You’re trying Level. I think @NickElle is/was with CDBaby. I’m with Distrokid.
It’s good that we’ll have real experience to share about the various options.

Read full topic
